headline: BlackRock research arm bigs up hedge funds to investors
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -The BlackRock Investment Institute believes investors should bulk up their exposure to hedge funds, the company said on Thursday.  The research arm of the asset manager suggests investors dedicate up to 5% more of their portfolios from their current levels to hedge fund investments, the highest the institute has ever recommended.  Investors might take money from holdings in developed market government bonds and instead use this money for less risky hedge funds, it said in a note.
